ok thank you

Hello I am trying to use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/feedback-submissions|feedback submissions API>, which I see is in beta. I am confused though because it says on the page:
> Please note: the feedback submissions endpoints are currently read only. Feedback submissions cannot be submitted or edited through the API.
However the endpoints list a `create` endpoint. I tried the `create` endpoint with the scopes listed in the documentation `crm.objects.contacts.write` and I get an error:

`Object type FEEDBACK_SUBMISSION is not supported by this endpoint`

When I try the list endpoint with the scopes listed in the documentation `crm.objects.contacts.read` I get the following error:

`This app hasn't been granted all required scopes to make this call`

It looks like the scopes listed in the documentation are wrong since a scope exists for `crm.objects.feedback_submissions.read` and with it enabled there is no error for the list endpoint.

In that case I am assuming the documentation is also wrong for the scopes listed on the create endpoint and wrong in listing the endpoint in the first place since it isn’t available and the `write` scopes do not exist.

Can anyone confirm this or does anyone have any further information on the status of this API and how to actually use it? Any help is greatly appreciated.

Hello all,

Inversion of label and description fields with the hs_persona field..

I retrieve with the "HubSpot-api-nodejs" module the hs_persona property (`HubSpotClient.crm.properties.coreApi.getByName("contact", "hs_persona", false, undefined)`).

In the response, the label field show me the description value and the description field give me the label value.

Do you need any further information?

I am submitting a HubSpot from through API, where I am including all the fields, and in the context I added `pageUri`,`pageName`,`hutk`

But I am getting a warning on the form submission that I ‘didn’t include an IP address’
Where do i get this ip?

I was thinking of using this api <https://api.ipify.org/?format=json> and fill it in but I am not sure if this is the right approach.

See screenshot of the warning:
Hey guys! How can I get hidden files via *`/files/v3/files/search`* ?
Hi. Take a look at that: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Ability-to-access-hidden-files-over-the-API/idc-p/426723/highlight/true#M79655>
If you have any custom fields that use the HubSpot user data type, they will show up in the all owner id's call.

Hello everyone ! :wave:

Since yesterday, I have started to learn dev in HubSpot, and I am now focused on API. I read documentation about it, and I am now starting to test everything I learnt. However, I am facing error, that I don't manage to fix. Here is my error message :
```Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'properties')```
I think that my request can't access the field, but I don't know how to make it visible / make it accessible.

Any help would be appreciated :slightly_smiling_face: Can jump on a Google Meet if it's easier !

Welcome to the world of HubSpot Development!!
Would be helpful if you provide more detail about this
what was your request?
what was the body of your request?

with that additional info, someone from the community will be more likely to be able to help!

Hello dennis, thank you for your message :slightly_smiling_face:

Here is my goal :
• Get an email address from a precise contact in a HubSpot workflow 
• Split the email address in two parts (before @ / after @)
• Re inject both part in two different fields with update
Here is how I get my email address : `const contactEmail = contact.body.properties.email;`

Here is how I try to reinject : `outputFields: {`
        `emailBeforeAt: emailBeforeAt,`
        `emailAfterAt: emailAfterAt`
Get the clients IP address and send it with your API post

Thanks Justin,
My question was how do i get it. I already showed one way I think i can but what do you thik of the approach?

The error you’ve posted suggests an issue with either the request you’re making to retrieve the contact and/or how you’re targeting the contact object.

Sharing the code of the request you’re making, as well as the value of the contact variable assignment will enable us to help you much more effectively.
Where are you getting the form data from? A web page?
Yes, a custom contact form of a webpage.

is anyone familiar with the changeSource and sourceId values passed from a webhook call? There are docs but they seem to not include a changeSource of HubSpot_INTERNAL, and I don't know what a sourceId of "CompanyInsightsPropertyMappings" means..

Going out on a limb here but I imagine this is what a CompanyInsightsPropertyMappings sourceId would come from:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/companies/HubSpot-insights-on-company-records>
I imagine anything that shows up as “HubSpot calculation” in property history would fall into `HubSpot_INTERNAL`

Hi all, in the company we work for we are doing integrations with HubSpot API conversations, for a new requirement we need to create an outbound flow through the whatsapp connection that sends information with variables fed with information from the backend, such as OTP, Renewal date, among others. It is posible to integrate HubSpot in our backend, such send otps via api conversations=
<@U01QVR44MEY> I know you are big fan of behavioral events, maybe you know how to do this?

Is it possible to include property filters in the GET*`/crm/v3/objects/companies`* API?
Does anyone have any examples?
you have to use POST `/crm/v3/objects/companies/search` I believe

Good deal - if you look at the dropdown right next to the full screen button in the inner editor frame, I’m going to assume it indicates you’re using the v8 of the HubSpot client.

This will pull in the V3 of the API client - with that update, they changed the response object structure a bit - you no longer have to go through the body object when using the wrapped endpoints.

So instead of `contact.body.properties`
you’ll just go with `contact.properties`

Possible the API docs are a bit outdated - haven’t looked. But that should fix your issue.

npm readme has some useful info in it - <https://www.npmjs.com/package/@HubSpot/api-client>
Thank you, Jacob. I'll check it out!
Thanks for your info, will be looking for it :wink:
Hi all, since there doesn't seem to be a webhook for when a form submission is received, I'm wondering if anyone has come up with a workaround in the past? Thanks
